author: CBC News
title: What you need to know about COVID-19 in B.C. on April 15, 2020
description: B.C. passed a milestone this week, recording more than 1,500 confirmed cases of COVID-19 to date. Seventy-two people have died of the disease.
content:
THE LATEST:
  • Provincial health officer Dr. Bonnie Henry will give her daily update at 3 p.m. PT.
  • 1,517 people have tested positive for COVID-19 in B.C.
  • 72 people have died of the disease.
